botanical_details.potentially_harmful: May irritate skin and eyes. Harmful if eaten. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling.
botanical_details.genus: Sambucus can be herbaceous perennials, deciduous shrubs or small trees, with pinnate leaves and umbels or panicles of small creamy-white flowers followed by red, white or black berries

how_to_grow.cultivation: Will tolerate most soils in moderately fertile well-drained soil in full sun or partial-shade, prefering full sun to achieve the darkest leaf colour. Feed and water until well established, and lightly prune to keep in shape if necessary requiring little maintenance after that.
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate from hard-wood or soft-wood cuttings.
how_to_grow.pruning: Minimal pruning in winter for general maintenance and to keep in shape. It will tolerate hard pruning to rejuvenate if required.
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to blackfly and glasshouse red spider mite
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to Verticillium wilt
